showScoreExcerpt:
"The characters, broadened and amped up several notches to register on the large stage of a Broadway house, eventually do endear themselves even if they are just a bit shy of caricature...Nelson and Bareilles have turned 'Waitress' into a boisterous, lovable, but unsubtle musical! Nothing wrong with that...Diane Paulus, for once, doesnâ€™t gild the lily with outrageous theatrical gimmickry, instead allowing the libretto and songs to shine through the unadorned, powered by moving performances."
